name: chatgpt_gdb_300x600_1800_undersized
description: [ChatGPT] GDB 300x600 at 1800 mÂ³/h â†’ undersized (1700), suggest 600x600
query: I need a GDB housing 300x600 for 1800 mÂ³/h airflow. FZ material.

turns.content: I need a GDB housing 300x600 for 1800 mÂ³/h airflow. FZ material.

To handle the required airflow of 1800 mÂ³/h with a 300x600mm duct, two GDB-300x600 housings are needed in parallel. The effective housing dimensions will be 600x600mm.Since the airflow exceeds the capacity of a single 300x600 module (1700 mÂ³/h), arranging two units in parallel is necessary to meet the demand.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified that the requested airflow (1800 mÂ³/h) exceeds the rated capacity of a single GDB 300x600 unit (1700 mÂ³/h). It provided a technically safe solution by recommending two units in parallel. However, it missed the opportunity to recommend the standard GDB 600x600 SKU (which has 3400 mÂ³/h capacity) and did not explicitly ask for housing length, defaulting to the standard version.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly retrieved the airflow capacity for GDB 300x600 as 1700 mÂ³/h (verified against PDF p.9) and correctly identified FZ material as C2/Indoor (PDF p.8).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the airflow constraint but fails to mention the necessary duct transitions for a parallel arrangement or ask for housing length (Standard vs Short).
dimension_explanations.safety: The system correctly blocked the undersized configuration (1800 mÂ³/h > 1700 mÂ³/h limit), preventing a high-pressure-drop/unsafe velocity scenario.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The logic to double the units is physically sound, but recommending two 300x600 modules is less practical than recommending the single GDB 600x600 SKU listed in the same table.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Respects the airflow limits and material constraints perfectly.

strengths: Accurate verification of airflow capacity limits (1700 mÂ³/h limit for 300x600 verified on PDF p.9)
Correct mapping of FZ material to Corrosion Class C2 and Indoor use
weaknesses: Recommended two separate 300x600 units instead of the standard single GDB 600x600 SKU
Did not clarify housing length (Standard vs Short), though the assumption of Standard was safe for capacity
pdf_citations: GDB Material: FZ = C2, Indoor use (PDF p.8)

openai.explanation: The system correctly identified that a single GDB-300x600 is rated 1700 mÂ³/h, but the proposed solution of â€œtwo housings in parallelâ€ contradicts the userâ€™s stated duct size (300x600) and is not a valid way to achieve 1800 mÂ³/h through that same duct cross-section. It also skipped required configuration details (housing length 550/600 vs 750/800, connection type, door side) and duplicated product cards inconsistently.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF shows GDB size 300x600 has FlÃ¶de 1700 mÂ³/h and length options 550/600 or 750/800, but the claim that two parallel housings solve 1800 mÂ³/h for a 300x600 duct is engineering-incorrect for a fixed 300x600 connection and the response also output an extra (third) product card.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Missing mandatory order parameters (GDB length variant, PG vs flange, right/left door) and doesnâ€™t address how the ductwork would physically be arranged to parallelize flow.
dimension_explanations.safety: No direct unsafe material recommendation (FZ indoor C2 is consistent with GDB being for indoor use), but it fails to warn that the proposed parallel arrangement implies a duct split/transition and may create leakage/bypass/commissioning issues.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and clear technical language appropriate for HVAC product consulting.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning stops at nameplate airflow comparison and makes a major leap from â€˜exceeds 1700â€™ to â€˜two in parallelâ€™ without checking the hard constraint that the user requested a 300x600 housing/duct size.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates practical product/installation constraints by effectively changing the connection geometry (stating effective 600x600) while still presenting GDB-300x600 units, and it provides product cards before collecting the required length/connection options.

strengths: Correctly references the catalog airflow capacity for GDB-300x600 and recognizes the exceedance vs 1800 mÂ³/h.
Maintains a professional sales-engineering tone and presents structured product info.
weaknesses: Incorrect sizing/arrangement logic: parallel housings are not a valid solution when the required connection remains 300x600 unless transitions/split ducts are explicitly designed and accepted.
Incomplete specification: omits GDB length variant (550/600 vs 750/800) and other ordering essentials; also inconsistent duplication of product cards.
pdf_citations: GDB 300x600: FlÃ¶de = 1700 mÂ³/h; available lengths 550/600 and 750/800 (GDB MÃ…TT table, page showing GDB dimensions/flows).
GDB 600x600: FlÃ¶de = 3400 mÂ³/h (same GDB MÃ…TT table), contradicting the idea that two 300x600 in parallel simply becomes an 'effective 600x600' without transitions.

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies GDB 300x600 airflow as 1700 mÂ³/h (matching PDF p.9), but the parallel arrangement logic is flawed â€” two 300x600 units in parallel would yield 600x1200mm effective dimensions, not 600x600mm. Three product cards were generated instead of two, and the system failed to ask for housing length (550 or 750mm), which is a required parameter for GDB.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDB 300x600 airflow of 1700 mÂ³/h matches PDF p.9, but claiming two 300x600 in parallel equals 600x600mm is geometrically incorrect (it would be 300x1200 or 600x600 depending on stacking orientation), and three product cards were shown instead of two.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system failed to ask for housing length (550mm or 750mm), which is a mandatory parameter for GDB; also missing weight info, connection type confirmation, and door handing.
dimension_explanations.safety: No unsafe configuration was recommended, but no warnings about the airflow mismatch implications or alternative single-housing options (e.g., GDB 600x600 at 3400 mÂ³/h which easily covers 1800 mÂ³/h) were provided.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative tone appropriate for technical sales context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The parallel arrangement reasoning is confusing â€” the system says two 300x600 units yield 600x600mm effective dimensions, which is not geometrically clear, and a simpler solution (single GDB 600x600) was not considered.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Housing length was not clarified before recommendation; three cards were shown when the text says two units are needed.

strengths: Correctly identified GDB 300x600 airflow capacity as 1700 mÂ³/h from the catalog
Correctly identified that 1800 mÂ³/h exceeds the single 300x600 module capacity
weaknesses: Failed to ask for housing length (550 or 750mm), a required GDB parameter, before providing a recommendation
Three product cards were generated instead of two, contradicting the system's own stated recommendation of two units
Did not suggest the simpler alternative of a single GDB 600x600 (3400 mÂ³/h capacity) which would easily handle 1800 mÂ³/h in one unit
The geometric explanation of parallel arrangement (claiming 600x600mm effective size) is unclear and potentially incorrect
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: FlÃ¶de = 3400 mÂ³/h (PDF p.9) â€” would be a simpler single-unit solution

reasoning_paths.path: Material locked to FZ -> Filter 300x600mm -> Sized to 300x600 -> Code: GDB-300x600-R-PG-FZ

content_segments.text: To handle the required airflow of 1800 mÂ³/h with a 300x600mm duct, two GDB-300x600 housings are needed in parallel.
The effective housing dimensions will be 600x600mm.
Since the airflow exceeds the capacity of a single 300x600 module (1700 mÂ³/h), arranging two units in parallel is necessary to meet the demand.
